solution_line_template: Two pairs of jeans cost ${price_per_pair} x {num_pairs_for_base_cost} = $<<{price_per_pair}*{num_pairs_for_base_cost}={cost_two_pairs_initial}>>{cost_two_pairs_initial}.
A discount of ${cost_two_pairs_initial} x {discount_percentage} = $<<{cost_two_pairs_initial}*{discount_percentage}={discount_amount}>>{discount_amount} will be given for this.

Hence, the cost of two pairs of jeans will now be ${cost_two_pairs_initial} - ${discount_amount} = $<<{cost_two_pairs_initial}-{discount_amount}={cost_two_pairs_after_discount}>>{cost_two_pairs_after_discount}.

Therefore, the customer will pay ${cost_two_pairs_after_discount} + ${price_for_third_pair} = $<<{cost_two_pairs_after_discount}+{price_for_third_pair}={total_cost_three_pairs}>>{total_cost_three_pairs} for the three pairs of jeans.
